messages: 5481f19ad35ac35f54bb65a671cbd122 (22:04): folks how do i get files opened (pfiles) from a process core in mdb?
00760906c5917778d4e64bff7b053d8d (22:25): any WORKING ident daemon under gnusol ?
a5e1dcc619bef690cb6ce4ad4a308ea9 (22:27): gnusol ... that's pretty vague... is that someone's packaged up version? or just someone installing a bunch of GNU stuff on top of opensolaris
a5e1dcc619bef690cb6ce4ad4a308ea9 (22:27): I've always wondered why sun never shipped an identd :P
00760906c5917778d4e64bff7b053d8d (22:28): dwc-: for postgresql it's kinda mandatory
a5e1dcc619bef690cb6ce4ad4a308ea9 (22:28): wilbury: is it? why are aren't you authenticating with say... passwords
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (22:29): i was able to apt-get install midentd just fine
00760906c5917778d4e64bff7b053d8d (22:29): dwc-: at least for installation from package
a5e1dcc619bef690cb6ce4ad4a308ea9 (22:30): so... it's not postgres, it's nexenta's postgres package
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (22:31): pretty sure nexentas postgres would be just like debians, which does not require ident at all
00760906c5917778d4e64bff7b053d8d (22:31): FATAL:  Ident authentication failed for user "postgres"
00760906c5917778d4e64bff7b053d8d (22:31): LOG:  Ident authentication is not supported on local connections on this platform
a5e1dcc619bef690cb6ce4ad4a308ea9 (22:31): so turn off identd authentication in the config file
a5e1dcc619bef690cb6ce4ad4a308ea9 (22:32): or if you don't like your distro's package, install it from src
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (22:32): claims "A package providing ident-server is needed if you want to authenticate remote connections with identd."
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (22:32): don't think ident will help, it's saying "local connections"
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (22:33): justin: it's Ubuntu's Postgres package which by default uses identd
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (22:33): nexenta is downstream from ubuntu, so they inherit whatever ubuntu does
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (22:34): postgres uses ident only for local connections and to authenticate the 'postgres' user..
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (22:34): I don't think they expect anyone to actually use remote ident for real authentication
00760906c5917778d4e64bff7b053d8d (22:35): proper installation needs working ident daemon
00760906c5917778d4e64bff7b053d8d (22:35): i don't plan to use it in future
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (22:35): so just install the ident daemon already
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (22:37): seems to be a general solaris thing.. it isn't listed under "Ident Authentication over Local Sockets"
00760906c5917778d4e64bff7b053d8d (22:38): i KNOW how to configure postgres, i KNOW how to use identd but i CAN NOT find ANY working identd for solaris
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (22:38): ooh, none of the packages work?
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (22:38): you may have to run inetconv or such to get solaris to pick up changes to inetd
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (22:41): wilbury: what's wrong with midentd or nullidentd?
631e53f91030c509ce45bb16bd235cdd (22:43): the thickheadness of mozilla developers is all too evident in their bugzilla comments.
00760906c5917778d4e64bff7b053d8d (23:01): ok, debian's ``pidentd'' with a small patch works
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (23:08): And finger, I would imagine.
3a52c91d35a6b62f1f61185196c040c6 (23:16): I'm doing a research on unix-like systems' differences in base system utilities (cp, rm, dd, top, ps, etc.)
3a52c91d35a6b62f1f61185196c040c6 (23:16): I thought about going through the GNU, Sun, FreeBSD and OpenBSD implementations of those tools
316982397a0e69355664adb9941f9144 (23:17): free & open will be the same
3a52c91d35a6b62f1f61185196c040c6 (23:17): Does OpenSolaris contain sources for the same exact tools found in Solaris 10?
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (23:17): my first introduction to the solaris tools was typing rm * -i, and it deleting all my files :)
3a52c91d35a6b62f1f61185196c040c6 (23:19): So, I should be okay by using Solaris 10 for testing the actual tools and use OpenSolaris sources to check how they're implemented in C?
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (23:19): no, opensolaris tools have evolved since solaris 10
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (23:19): you'd also want to look at the getopt implementation, since that probably has a lot to do with how they behave
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (23:19): some of the code may be the same, some may be different
316982397a0e69355664adb9941f9144 (23:20): oh, right... there's a bunch of oss-bite-size bugs that were implemented to give a few of the tools new options
631e53f91030c509ce45bb16bd235cdd (23:22): you could use Solaris Express instead of S10. then it would be a 1 for 1 match to the source code.
35655693ca3f701bbef2d21748646b07 (23:44): anybody ever ecounter a gnome-settings-daemon crash?
30304b9bc0a292e1440982ddf6a0c186 (23:44): too often to still use gnome..
